DataElement.preferredName: Randomization Book Entry Study Position Number ISO21090.INT.NONNEG.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An integer specifying the value of a numerical sequence for a Stratum Group that should be used to assign a subject to an arm or a portion of an arm. EXAMPLE(S): StratumGroup#: 0; Position: 0; Arm/Portion of Arm: A; StratumGroup#: 0; Position: 1; Arm/Portion of Arm: B. If 2 subjects fall in the same Stratum Group (i.e., 0 in the above example), the first subject will be assigned to Arm A because the current position would be 0 and the 2nd subject would be assigned to Arm B since the current position would be incremented by 1 each time an assignment happens.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Randomization Book Entry Study Position Number
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.:A volume made up of pages fastened along one edge and enclosed between protective covers. (from American Heritage Dictionary):An item inserted in a written or electronic record._An assignment to a portion of a study based on a set of criteria that ensures a desired distribution of subjects across all portions of a study.:A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
